channel.title: When reinstalling Windows
channel.description:
When you're reinstalling Windows like I did, make sure you let the computer know what you have. For example, I use a USB Port mouse, but when I reinstalled Windows it was detecting no mouse and something from the keyboard, making it unable to startup. I've known some people with this issue, so I'm just stating. Also, you can change it by when starting up you goto 'Setup'. I couldn't use my computer for months because of this.
Just posting this so if people ever reinstall Windows, that this would be a problem if your computer was detecting hardware that wasn't there ;)
~Lin

item.title: When reinstalling Windows
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

thanks i had that problem on my old computer.

Read full topic

item.title: When reinstalling Windows

item.description:
@Lin wrote:

When you’re reinstalling Windows like I did, make sure you let the computer know what you have. For example, I use a USB Port mouse, but when I reinstalled Windows it was detecting no mouse and something from the keyboard, making it unable to startup. I’ve known some people with this issue, so I’m just stating. Also, you can change it by when starting up you goto ‘Setup’. I couldn’t use my computer for months because of this.

Just posting this so if people ever reinstall Windows, that this would be a problem if your computer was detecting hardware that wasn’t there

~Lin
